subject: Learning
title: Use It or Lose It: The Cognitive Reserve Myth
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Use It or Lose It: The Cognitive Reserve Myth.

hook.text: Solve crossword puzzles daily and you'll never get dementia. If only it were that simple.

buildup.text: Cognitive reserve is the brain's ability to compensate for damage by using alternative neural paths.

discovery.text: Education, complex work, and social engagement build reserve. Puzzles alone don't provide enough challenge.

twist.text: Reserve delays symptoms of decline but doesn't prevent the underlying disease process.

climax.text: The best protection is a lifetime of varied cognitive, physical, and social engagementâ€”not one activity.

punchline.text: One trick won't save your brain. A rich life might.

quiz.question: What does cognitive reserve actually do?
options: It delays symptoms of cognitive decline by using alternative neural paths
It prevents all brain diseases permanently
It only comes from solving puzzles
